Comments: Contains narrow ringlets at 67,580 and 71,710 km.
Contains isolated “plateaus” among a surrounding, fainter ring.
Ringlet that occupies outer third of Colombo Gap. Also known as Colombo Ringlet.
Widest gap in the C Ring.
A narrow, eccentric ringlet inside a gap in the C Ring.
Gap due to second-order resonance with Mimas.
A narrow, sharp-edged ringlet inside a gap in the C Ring.
Very narrow gap
This feature has been referred to as ringlet, but it is not detached from the rest of the C ring.
Contains fine structure on all scales. The most opaque of Saturn’s rings.
Innermost region of B Ring. Characterized by undulations in optical depth and I/F.
Central region of B Ring. Characterized by alternating zones of high and low optical depth.
Central region of B Ring. Characterized by high optical depth. Median optical depth is 3.6, the highest of any region in the rings.
Outer region of B Ring. Here the optical depth gradually decreases, but in an irregular way.
Outermost region of B Ring, affected by its highly variable outer edge.
The prominent gap between the A and B Rings. It contains several features of low optical depth.
Approximate boundaries based on Table 3 of Ref 8.
A narrow, eccentric, inclined ringlet near the inner edge of the Cassini Division.
A fairly uniform ring with many density and bending waves, especially near its outer edge.
A gap in the A Ring maintained by the embedded moon Pan. One or more faint ringlets are also present.
A narrow gap in the outer A Ring maintained by the embedded moon Daphnis.
The separation between outer edge of A Ring and the F Ring.
A complex, narrow, eccentric, inclined ring with a denser core at a=140,224 km demonstrating a wide variety of quasi-stable and ephemeral structure.
A narrow, very faint ring in the region occuppied by Janus and Epimetheus.
A faint, isolated dust ring.
A broad, faint dust ring encompassing the orbits of Mimas through Dione. Densest near the orbit of Enceladus. Up to ~30,000 km in vertical extent.
A narrow, very faint ring in the the region occuppied by Methone.
A narrow, very faint ring in the orbit of Anthe.
A narrow, very faint ring in the region occuppied by Pallene.
A broad, faint ring in the orbit of Phoebe with a vertical extent of ~2,400,000 km.
